bridgingmod.config.failed_integration.de: Failed to open config UI. If you're in a snapshot, please do not report this as a bug.
config.bridgingmod.category.debug.toolti: Features that are useful for development, but you may find useful too.
config.bridgingmod.category.fixes.toolti: Nitpicky things that don't need changing, but could make the mod feel better.
config.bridgingmod.category.vfx.tooltip: Change how all the indicators look
config.bridgingmod.option.bridgingAdjace: Adjusts snapping behaviour. Finds blocks along the view path that get missed by the usual target finder.
Strict = Closest match to the view line only.
Faces = Include blocks sharing a face with the closest match
config.bridgingmod.option.bridgingSnapSt: ⚠ Experimental! This feature is very un-tested and works weird on close-up edges.
Resizes the hitbox used when bridging, smaller values being less sensitive.
0.8 = Sweet Spot. Weaker snapping, but with a bit of support.
config.bridgingmod.option.delayPostBridg: How many ticks need to pass (20 ticks = 1 second) before you're allowed to bridge another block? This affects the building speed as you hold down your block place button.
config.bridgingmod.option.enableBridging: Should bedrock-like bridging be active? Basically enables/disables most of the mod.
This is also bound to a keybind in Controls (defaults to ',')
^ a.k.a. Reacharound Placement, similar to Quark
config.bridgingmod.option.enableNonSolid: Allows Bridging to replace 'replaceable' blocks like tall-grass & water.
config.bridgingmod.option.enableSlabAssi: Smarter slab placing! Makes slabs (and trapdoors) interact better with the mod by:
- Aligning them to your y-level when bridging horizontally
- Combining them in stacks when bridging vertically
config.bridgingmod.option.minBridgeDista: How far must a block be from you to be bridgable from.
How far must a block be from you horizontally to be bridgable from.
How far must a block be from you vertically to be bridgable from.
config.bridgingmod.option.nonBridgeRespe: Show Non-Bridging Block Outline when Bridging is enabled
If this is on, the Non-Bridging highlight is affected by that setting and is only visible when Bridging is available.
config.bridgingmod.option.onlyBridgeWhen: If this is enabled, Bridging only becomes active while the player is sneaking.
This is similar to the 'Toggle Reacharound Placement' keybind changing Bridging's availability.
Sets the outline colour for both Bridging & Non-Bridging block outlines.
Opacity of 0.4 recommended, unless you want some intense colours.
config.bridgingmod.option.perspectiveLoc: How should placement positions be calculated? Should it copy your current perspective (i.e, first & third person. F5), or should it always use the player head's view line?
If you're using a 'Free Look' or 'Better Third Person' and you don't like the default behaviour, try changing this.
Adds arrows around your crosshair when bridging is active, indicating roughly where your block will be bridged off of (Up, Horizontal, Down)
config.bridgingmod.option.showDebugHighl: Show Bridging Block Outline In F3
See Visual->Show Bridging Block Outline, but with F3
config.bridgingmod.option.showDebugTrace: Show Bridging Block Trail In F3
Lightly outlines all the block positions that have been checked & skipped when trying to find a bridging target. Quite distracting!
config.bridgingmod.option.showNonBridgin: Show Non-Bridging Block Outline in F3
See Visual->Show Non-Bridging Block Outline, but with F3
config.bridgingmod.option.showOutline.de: Shows an outline (similar to the vanilla block break outline) whenever bridging is active, highlighting the spot where your block will be bridged.
config.bridgingmod.option.showOutlineEve: Shows an outline wherever you're about to place a block when Bridging is not being used (i.e, normal block placing)
config.bridgingmod.option.skipTorchBridg: Prevents accidental torch placing by stopping them from being used at all by Bridging
config.bridgingmod.option.supportedBridg: Want to use bridging only horizontally like bedrock? This setting limits bridging to certain axes.
See 'Bridging Axis', but this overrides it's behaviour when you are sneaking.
'Same as Usual' copies whatever 'Bridging Axis' is set to.
config.bridgingmod.title: Bridging Mod
